revised_title: Thermodynamic Properties of Solid and Fluid Helium-3 and Helium-4 at High Densities
tldr: This article presents measurements of the specific heat at constant volume of solid helium-3 and helium-4 at various temperatures and densities. The results are explained using the zero-point energy of the solids and a quasi-harmonic model of lattice vibrations. The study provides insights into the thermodynamic properties of these isotopes and their behavior at high densities and low temperatures.
